areaDescription: Crisis transforms this frontier outpost from peaceful haven to fortress under siege. Weathered timber walkways now bear the scars of hasty fortification, while the clearing echoes with urgent voices and the clash of hastily prepared weapons. The spicy tang of pine sap mingles with smoke from signal fires and the metallic scent of fear. Rangers move with grim purpose between reinforced positions, their usual confidence replaced by the weight of impending catastrophe threatening to overwhelm their small garrison.

locations.name: Rangers' Command Post
locations.description: Smoke rises from hastily extinguished signal fires as the heart of the outpost thrums with barely contained crisis. Ranger Elen paces beside a weathered oak table strewn with blood-stained maps and urgent dispatch scrolls, her weathered face grim as she studies reports of the third caravan attack this week. The silver bells that usually chime softly now hang silent and ominous, their network disrupted by whatever stalks the forest paths.

npcs.name: Ranger Elen
npcs.description: The steadfast commander of Thornwood Outpost, Elen bears the weight of protecting the frontier trade routes. Her weathered leathers speak of countless patrols, and her sharp gaze misses nothing. Though duty binds her to this post, worry creases her brow as reports from other regions grow more troubling.
npcs.attitude: Professional but concerned, testing the party's competence while revealing the burden of command.

npcs.name: Ranger Marcus
npcs.description: A grizzled veteran scout with weathered hands and keen eyes, Marcus has patrolled these forests for over a decade. He knows every trail, every hiding spot, and has countless stories of close calls with bandits and wild beasts.
npcs.attitude: Gruff but helpful, willing to share patrol knowledge and trail wisdom with those who prove themselves worthy of respect.

npcs.name: Scout Kira
npcs.description: A young, eager ranger who reports directly to Elen and frequently carries messages between outposts. Her enthusiasm is infectious, though her inexperience sometimes shows in her overeager questions and bright-eyed optimism.
npcs.attitude: Enthusiastic and talkative, eager to prove herself and always ready to share the latest news and gossip from other ranger posts.

npcs.name: Messenger Tom
npcs.description: A road-weary courier who rides between settlements carrying dispatches and news. His horse shows signs of hard travel, and he always seems to be either arriving from or departing for another urgent delivery.
npcs.attitude: Tired but reliable, grateful for a safe place to rest and always willing to share news from distant settlements in exchange for a hot meal.

lootTable: Detailed regional map marking bandit activity
Ranger's field guide to local threats
plotHooks: Elen urgently recruits the party as three caravans have been destroyed in five days with escalating brutality
A captured bandit leader awaits interrogation in the outpost's holding area
Strange reports from northern patrols describe wildlife fleeing and unnatural phenomena
Merchant confidence wavers as attacks grow bolder and more organized
locations.dmInstructions: Start with immediate tension - Elen is clearly overwhelmed and desperate for help. The recent escalation in attacks has her on edge. She cannot leave her post but provides tactical support and equipment. Emphasize the time pressure: more caravans are expected, and the situation is deteriorating rapidly. The party represents her last hope before requesting expensive reinforcements from distant settlements.
dcChecks: Insight DC 12: Notice Elen's concern about reports from distant regions, hinting at larger threats
Investigation DC 10: Study the tactical maps to understand bandit movement patterns
Perception DC 8: Hear the subtle signals from the silver bell network warning of approaching activity
locations.accessibility: Central hub with clear sight lines to all outpost approaches

features.name: Command Table
features.description: A sturdy oak table bearing maps, dispatch scrolls, and tactical markers showing current threats and patrol routes.

features.name: Silver Bell Network
features.description: Delicate silver bells strung on nearly invisible lines, creating an early warning system for the outpost's approaches.

features.name: Ranger Equipment Racks
features.description: Well-maintained racks holding spare bows, quivers, and survival gear for rangers heading out on patrol.

locations.name: Supply Depot
locations.description: Wooden crates and canvas-wrapped supplies line the riverbank where merchant barges dock to resupply the outpost. Quartermaster Brann oversees the careful inventory, his weathered hands checking manifests against dwindling stores. The gentle lap of water against the dock mingles with the creak of rope and timber, while nervous traders eye the forest treeline.

npcs.name: Quartermaster Brann
npcs.description: A methodical dwarf with ink-stained fingers and a sharp eye for detail, Brann maintains the outpost's supplies with military precision. Recent shortages have made him increasingly cautious about who gets access to equipment and rations.
npcs.attitude: Businesslike and protective of supplies, but will warm to characters who prove their worth to the outpost.

npcs.name: Dock Worker Finn
npcs.description: A burly human who handles the loading and unloading of supply barges at the riverside dock. His clothes are perpetually damp from river spray, and he knows every merchant barge captain who travels these waters.
npcs.attitude: Friendly and chatty, always eager to share river gossip and stories about the various merchants and their cargo.

npcs.name: Merchant Vera
npcs.description: A nervous middle-aged trader whose own caravan was attacked two weeks ago. She lost most of her goods but escaped with her life, and now helps Brann with supply inventory while waiting for safe passage home.
npcs.attitude: Anxious but grateful for shelter, willing to share detailed accounts of bandit tactics and warning signs she noticed before her attack.

npcs.name: Apprentice Jeb
npcs.description: Brann's young assistant, a well-meaning but clumsy human who handles the simpler supply tasks. He's eager to please but prone to dropping things and mixing up inventory counts.
npcs.attitude: Enthusiastic and helpful, though often apologetic about his mistakes. Looks up to the rangers and dreams of joining their ranks someday.

lootTable: Waterproof supply manifest showing recent shortages
plotHooks: Supply shortages suggest someone is stealing or intercepting shipments
Merchant barge arrivals have become increasingly irregular and nervous
Brann mentions unusual equipment requests from supposedly legitimate traders
locations.dmInstructions: Brann can provide basic equipment and supplies to the party, but requires proof of their legitimacy. He's a good source for information about supply chain disruptions and suspicious merchant activity.
dcChecks: Investigation DC 11: Examine supply manifests to notice patterns in missing shipments
Persuasion DC 13: Convince Brann to share information about suspicious merchant requests
Perception DC 9: Notice nervous behavior from traders docking at the depot
locations.accessibility: Open dock area with clear river access for supply barges

features.name: Supply Dock
features.description: A sturdy wooden dock extending into the river, designed for merchant barges to safely unload cargo.

features.name: Inventory Ledgers
features.description: Detailed logs tracking all incoming and outgoing supplies, meticulously maintained by Quartermaster Brann.

features.name: Storage Crates
features.description: Weatherproof crates and canvas-wrapped bundles containing essential supplies for the outpost's operations.

locations.name: Trader's Rest
locations.description: Among ancient stone foundations, canvas pavilions and merchant stalls create a bustling temporary market. Trader Sila moves between worried merchants, her quick words and reassuring gestures keeping commerce flowing despite growing fears. The old stones provide some shelter, while colorful trade goods contrast sharply with the weathered ruins.

npcs.name: Trader Sila
npcs.description: A sharp-eyed half-elf with silver-streaked hair and quick gestures, Sila coordinates the merchant community at the outpost. Her network of contacts spans the region, making her invaluable for gathering information about bandit activities and trade route dangers.
npcs.attitude: Friendly but stressed, eager to share information with anyone who might help restore safe passage for merchants.

npcs.name: Merchant Gareth
npcs.description: A portly human trader who specializes in general goods and basic supplies. His wagon is currently being repaired after damage from a recent bandit encounter, and he's frustrated by the delays to his trading schedule.
npcs.attitude: Worried and impatient, constantly checking on his damaged wagon and eager to discuss the deteriorating safety of the trade routes.

npcs.name: Trader Mila
npcs.description: An exotic goods merchant with items from distant lands, Mila has been stranded at the outpost longer than expected. She deals in rare spices, unusual trinkets, and has heard disturbing rumors about supernatural corruption.
npcs.attitude: Mysterious but helpful, willing to trade information about strange occurrences for protection or safe passage to her next destination.

npcs.name: Caravan Guard Bex
npcs.description: A retired soldier turned caravan guard who now helps coordinate security for merchant groups. Her experience shows in her alert posture and the practical arrangement of her weapons and armor.
npcs.attitude: Professional and direct, focused on practical security matters and always assessing potential threats to merchant caravans.

lootTable: Assorted trade goods from various regions
Map of regional trade routes with danger markings
plotHooks: Sila has detailed information about bandit attack patterns and locations
Merchant testimonies reveal the bandits are unusually well-equipped and organized
Traders are considering abandoning the route entirely if safety isn't restored soon
Strange buyers have been purchasing unusual supplies before disappearing into the wilds
locations.dmInstructions: Sila serves as an information hub for the merchant community. She can provide detailed intelligence about bandit activities and trade route dangers, and may offer rewards for ensuring merchant safety.
dcChecks: Persuasion DC 12: Convince nervous merchants to share details about bandit attacks
Investigation DC 10: Study trade route maps to identify vulnerability patterns
Insight DC 13: Recognize which merchants might have information about unusual buyers
locations.accessibility: Open market area built among ancient ruins foundations

features.name: Ancient Stone Foundations
features.description: Weathered stone foundations of an old structure, now repurposed as anchor points for merchant pavilions.

features.name: Merchant Pavilions
features.description: Colorful canvas stalls displaying wares from across the region, creating a bustling temporary marketplace.

features.name: Trade Route Map Board
features.description: A large wooden board where merchants post warnings, route conditions, and recent attack locations.

locations.name: Scout's Watch
locations.description: A raised wooden platform overlooks the river crossing, providing clear sight lines across the water and into the forest beyond. Scout Neris maintains vigilant watch from this vantage point, her spyglass scanning for threats while signal mirrors catch the light for long-distance communication. The sound of flowing water masks quiet conversations about patrol routes and suspicious movement.

npcs.name: Scout Neris
npcs.description: A keen-eyed human ranger with wind-tousled hair and calloused hands from years of frontier duty. Neris has an encyclopedic knowledge of the surrounding wilderness and can spot trouble from miles away. She's recently returned from investigating strange phenomena in the northern woods.
npcs.attitude: Alert and professional, eager to share intelligence about wilderness threats but cautious about venturing too far from her watch post.

lootTable: Detailed wilderness maps with recent annotations
plotHooks: Neris has observed unusual lights and movement in the northern forest
Wildlife has been fleeing southward in unprecedented numbers
Strange travelers have been spotted moving at night toward the corrupted areas
Communication with northern patrol posts has become sporadic and concerning
locations.dmInstructions: Scout Neris provides reconnaissance intelligence and can guide the party to specific locations in the wilderness. She's the best source for information about the supernatural phenomena affecting the northern reaches.
dcChecks: Perception DC 10: Spot distant movement or signals that Neris points out
Survival DC 12: Understand the significance of wildlife migration patterns Neris describes
Investigation DC 11: Study Neris's annotated maps to identify patterns in the strange phenomena
locations.accessibility: Elevated watch platform accessible by wooden ladder

features.name: Watch Platform
features.description: A sturdy wooden platform raised above the treeline, providing commanding views of the river crossing and forest approaches.

features.name: Signal Equipment
features.description: Mirrors, flags, and other communication tools for coordinating with distant patrols and the main outpost.

features.name: Observation Logs
features.description: Detailed written records of movements, weather patterns, and unusual sightings maintained by the scout.

locations.name: Prisoner's Hold
locations.description: A small natural cave reinforced with iron bars and guarded by rangers serves as the outpost's holding cell. Captured Bandit Leader Rusk sits chained within, his scarred face showing both defiance and cunning. The damp stone walls echo with his occasional taunts, while nervous guards debate whether his information is worth the risk of keeping him alive.

npcs.name: Captured Bandit Leader Rusk
npcs.description: A weathered human with calculating eyes and numerous scars, Rusk led the bandit gang terrorizing the trade routes. Despite his capture, he retains an air of dangerous confidence, hinting at knowledge that could prove valuable - or deadly. His equipment suggests backing from sources more sophisticated than typical brigands.
npcs.attitude: Defiant but pragmatic, willing to trade information for better treatment or freedom, but not trustworthy.

lootTable: Confiscated bandit equipment of unusual quality
Encrypted message found on Rusk during capture
Map fragment showing unknown locations in the northern woods
plotHooks: Rusk claims his gang was hired by mysterious benefactors with deep pockets
The bandit leader hints at supernatural forces backing the increased attacks
Rusk knows the location of a larger bandit stronghold in the Thornwood
Information about the source of the bandits' unusually good equipment and coordination
locations.dmInstructions: Rusk is the key to unlocking the next phase of the adventure. He can provide crucial information about bandit operations and supernatural backing, but requires careful handling. Consider what the party offers in exchange for information.

doors.name: Iron Bar Gate
doors.description: Heavy iron bars reinforced with steel bands, securely locked to contain dangerous prisoners.

dcChecks: Insight DC 14: Determine when Rusk is telling the truth versus attempting manipulation
Intimidation DC 13: Pressure Rusk to reveal information about his backers
Persuasion DC 15: Convince Rusk that cooperation serves his best interests
locations.accessibility: Secured cave with iron bar gate, requires key or guard permission for access

features.name: Iron Bar Cell
features.description: A reinforced prison cell with heavy iron bars and secure locking mechanism, designed to hold dangerous criminals.

features.name: Guard Post
features.description: A small area outside the cell where rangers maintain watch over the prisoner and his belongings.

features.name: Evidence Lockbox
features.description: A secured container holding items confiscated from the prisoner, including weapons and mysterious documents.

randomEncounters.description: A wandering animal appropriate for level 1 parties
A lost traveler appropriate for level 1 parties
A environmental hazard appropriate for level 1 parties
A lost traveler appropriate for level 1 parties
A environmental hazard appropriate for level 1 parties
A wandering animal appropriate for level 1 parties
A lost traveler appropriate for level 1 parties
A environmental hazard appropriate for level 1 parties
A wandering animal appropriate for level 1 parties
A wandering animal appropriate for level 1 parties

notes: Weather and terrain should affect travel times. Random encounters keep exploration tense.
